name: Wiener Porzellan Josef Böck
biography: The Josef Böck Vienna Porcelain manufactory was active between 1828 and 1933. Böck frequently worked with the Wiener Werkstätte, producing ceramic objects by such designers as Josef Hoffmann, Koloman Moser, and Jutta Sika. The firm produced ceramics both in historicist styles that were popular in the nineteenth century and the more modern aesthetic of the Viennese Secession and the Wiener Werkstätte.
